Articles.Content: Yup, First full stock landing on Minmus with no mech jeb, no mods, no config messing aroundwithness...just plain ol stock parts. For me? This is a big step, as I\'ve only ever landed on the Mun safely and returned to Kerbin, once.

Congratulations! Did the crew make it back home yet, or are they going to stay there and be a monument? And now that you\'ve gotten that accomplished, are you going to do more with only stock designs, or was once enough?

Yeah, I did that when Minmus first came out and MechJeb along with a lot of other mods had to be updated, so I had to do it all manually and with stock parts. It\'s obviously much harder, but it felt more like an accomplishment when I got back to Kerbin.
The crew also made a full safe return to kerbin, even missing a landing leg that had been ripped off during the landing...(which is typical of lander legs)

Wish I could say I did this, but I left a new crater on Minmus and then discovered that the ground I was approaching was 4 kilometers over lake level. That world is lumpy.

Really ramps up the difficulty curve over the Mun.
Nice! I had my first Stock-only Minmus landing when .15 came out, but I used a tutorial to get there. Congrats on getting there on your own!
